Requirements: Students must first apply to the university. A separate, departmental application must also be submitted online through Cal State Apply. The department application requirements include: Three letters of recommendation; A statement of purpose (see department website for writing prompts); Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended; GPA of 3.0 or better in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) of coursework; A bachelor’s degree in nutrition and dietetics or related field from a regionally accredited institution, or the equivalent from a foreign institution. The GRE is not required for admission.
Program name: Master of Arts in Applied Nutrition and Dietetics

Requirements:
Applicants must meet the university admission requirements. Students must meet the following school requirements for admission to the Master of Science program:

1. A bachelor’s degree with a major in Criminology and Criminal Justice from an accredited institution. Applicants with a baccalaureate degree in a related field will be considered.
2. An overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher.
3. A grade of “B” or better in an upper-division undergraduate research methods course.
4. A grade of “B” or better in an upper-division undergraduate statistics course.
5. Good academic standing at the last college or university attended.
6. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can attest to the applicant’s capacity to succeed in a graduate program.
7. A 2-4 page, typed statement of purpose that describes the applicant’s interest in the field of criminology and criminal justice, reasons for pursuing a master’s degree, and future career goals.
8. A resume or curriculum vitae (CV) that describes the applicant’s academic and any relevant professional experience.
9. A sample of the applicant’s scholarly writing (e.g., a term paper from a prior course).
Program name: Master of Science in Criminology and Criminal Justice

Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the university, applicants must meet the following department-specific requirements for admission to the MA in Kinesiology:
1. A bachelor’s degree in kinesiology or an equivalent degree from an accredited institution.
2. A grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) of coursework.

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Science in Kinesiology, the applicant must:
1. Hold a bachelor’s degree in Kinesiology or an allied field (e.g., biology, psychology, physiology, etc.) from an accredited institution. Students with undergraduate degrees outside of Kinesiology may be required to complete undergraduate prerequisite courses prior to advancement to candidacy in the program.
2. Have a GPA of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) of coursework. Applicants with a GPA between 2.75-2.99 may be considered for admission based on the number of applicants and the applicant’s statement of purpose, resume, and letters of recommendation.
3. Complete the following prerequisite courses with a grade of “C” or better:
    A. KIN 300 - Biomechanics of Human Movement (3 units)
    Prerequisite: For Kinesiology majors: BIOL 208 or equivalent. For non-Kinesiology majors: consent of instructor.
    B. KIN 301 - Exercise Physiology (3 units)
    Prerequisite: For Kinesiology majors: BIOL 208 or equivalent. For non-Kinesiology majors: consent of instructor.
    C. KIN 312 - Motor Control and Learning (3 units)
    Prerequisite: For Kinesiology majors: BIOL 208 and STAT 108 or equivalent. For non-Kinesiology majors: consent of instructor.
    D. KIN 332 - Sociocultural Dimensions of Sport/Human Movement (3 units)
    Prerequisite(s)/Corequisite(s): A GE Foundation course.
    E. KIN 363 - Developmental Motor Control and Learning (3 units)
    F. KIN 370 - Movement and the Mind-Body Connection (3 units)
4. Applicants without a bachelor’s degree in Kinesiology must complete prerequisite courses determined by the graduate advisor prior to admission to the program.
5. Submit the following materials directly to the Kinesiology Graduate Coordinator through the university’s online Cal State Apply application portal:
    A. A written statement of purpose;
    B. A current resume/curriculum vitae;
    C. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to the applicant’s academic and/or professional potential.
Program name: Master of Science in Kinesiology with option in Sport and Exercise Psychology

Requirements:
To be considered for admission, applicants must meet the following requirements:
- Completion of a bachelor's degree from a regionally-accredited institution with a minimum GPA of 3.0 in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units). Students with a GPA between 2.50 and 2.99 may be admitted conditionally.
- Completion of a Didactic Program in Dietetics (DPD) with a Verification Statement.
- International students must meet university requirements for English proficiency.

All prospective students must apply to the University through Cal State Apply. After university application has been completed, submit the following documents to the Program Director through the Program Application on the department website:
- Statement of Purpose
- Two Letters of Recommendation
- DPD Verification Statement (or Declaration of Intent)
- Transcripts from all colleges/universities attended
- Resume
Program name: Master of Science in Nutritional Science

Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements of the university, specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are:
1. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a major in health science (or equivalent) or a bachelor’s degree in another field.
2. A minimum of 3.0 GPA in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) of coursework.
3. Completion of HSC 403 or equivalent with a “B” or better within the last 5 years.
4. Completion of an introductory statistics course with a “B” or better.
5. At least one year of health-related work experience.
6. Two letters of recommendation from professional or academic sources.
7. A statement of purpose (500-750 words).
8. A resume.
Program name: Master of Public Health

Requirements: To be considered for admission to the MPA program, an applicant must submit a complete application through Cal State Apply and meet the following requirements: A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university. A minimum of 1 year of full-time professional work experience, or the equivalent. A grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of college coursework; students with a GPA between 2.75 and 3.0 may be admitted conditionally. Applicants must also submit three letters of recommendation, a three-to-five page typed, double-spaced 'Statement of Purpose', and a current resume. A score of at least 4.0 on the analytical writing section of the GRE or GMAT is listed as a requirement, though it may be waived under certain conditions.

Requirements:
The following is a list of the minimum requirements for admission to the MSW Program at CSULB:
- A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university.
- A grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of coursework. Applicants with a GPA between 2.5 and 2.99 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units may be considered for admission on an exceptional basis if their application is strong in all other areas.
- Successful completion of an introductory statistics course with a grade of 'C' or better. The statistics course must have been completed within 7 years of application to the MSW program.
- A minimum of 1,000 hours of paid and/or volunteer experience in human services at the time of application.
- A liberal arts foundation, demonstrated by completion of a baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution with a liberal arts focus OR completion of coursework from a variety of areas, such as humanities, fine arts, natural sciences, and social sciences.
- Evidence of personal qualifications, motivation, and experience that indicate the likelihood of success as a graduate student and a professional social worker. Such evidence is drawn from the applicant's autobiographical statement, letters of recommendation, and paid and/or volunteer experience in human services.

Required Supplemental Materials:
The following documents must be uploaded to your Cal State Apply application in the Program Materials section:
1. Autobiographical Statement
2. Three (3) Letters of Recommendation
3. Résumé
4. Unofficial Transcripts
5. Copy of course description and syllabus for prerequisite statistics course
Program name: Master of Social Work

Requirements: An applicant must have a minimum 3.0 grade point average (GPA) in the last 60 semester units of their B.A. degree. Prerequisite courses (or their equivalents) must be completed with a grade of 'C' or better prior to the start of the M.A. program. We recommend that applicants have no more than 2 prerequisite courses in-progress during the spring semester of application. Admission to the M.A. program is a two-part process. Applicants must apply to both the University (through Cal State Apply) and the Program (through CSDCAS). The GRE is not required for admission to the M.A. program.
Program name: Master of Arts in Speech-Language Pathology

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the M.A. program in Anthropology, applicants must meet the following minimum requirements:

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a major in anthropology or a related field.
A GPA of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of coursework.
At least 15 units of upper-division anthropology courses with a GPA of 3.2 or better. These should include courses in at least three of the subfields of anthropology (cultural anthropology, biological anthropology, archaeology, and linguistic anthropology) as well as a course in anthropological theory.
For students who do not meet these requirements, conditional admission may be possible. Conditionally-admitted students will be required to take a specified number of upper-division anthropology courses and receive a grade of B or better in each.
Program name: Master of Arts in Anthropology with option in General Anthropology

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the M.A. program in Anthropology, applicants must:
1. Have a bachelor’s degree in Anthropology or a related field with a GPA of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of coursework.
2. Demonstrate strong writing and analytical skills.

In addition to the university application submitted via Cal State Apply, all applicants must submit the following materials through Cal State Apply by the deadline:
- Statement of Purpose: In a 750-1,000 word essay, please address the following:
  - Your reasons for pursuing graduate study in applied anthropology.
  - Your specific areas of interest in applied anthropology.
  - The questions and issues you wish to explore in your graduate research.
  - Your career goals and how the M.A. in Applied Anthropology at CSULB will help you achieve them.
  - Your relevant academic, professional, and/or personal experience that has prepared you for graduate school.
- Writing Sample: A sample of your academic or professional writing (10-20 pages) that demonstrates your analytical and writing skills. This can be a term paper, an excerpt from an undergraduate thesis, a published article, or a professional report.
- Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can evaluate your academic and/or professional background and your potential for success in a graduate program.
- Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.

The GRE is not required for admission to our M.A. program.
Program name: Master of Arts in Anthropology with option in Applied Anthropology

Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements of the university, specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are:
1. A bachelor’s degree with a major in Asian Studies or another major approved by the graduate committee.
2. A minimum of 24 units of upper-division coursework in Asian studies or a related field with a GPA of at least 3.0. This coursework must be approved by the graduate advisor.
3. Demonstrated proficiency in an Asian language appropriate to the student’s proposed plan of study. Proficiency is defined as completing the equivalent of the fourth semester of the language at the university level with a grade of B or better. Students who cannot meet this requirement at the time of their admission may be admitted conditionally and will be required to complete this requirement by the time they have completed 12 units of graduate coursework at CSULB. These language courses cannot be counted as part of the student’s graduate program.
4. A minimum GPA of 3.0 in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) attempted and a minimum of 3.0 GPA in the undergraduate major.
5. Submission of the following materials directly to the AAAS Department Graduate Advisor:
    * Two letters of recommendation from individuals who can attest to the applicant’s academic potential.
    * A statement of purpose that explains the applicant’s interest in the program and their academic and professional goals.
    * A writing sample of at least ten pages that demonstrates the applicant’s writing and analytical skills.
Program name: Master of Arts in Asian Studies with option in General Asian Studies

Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements of the university, specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are:
1. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a major in Asian Studies, Chinese Studies, or Japanese Studies, or a bachelor’s degree in a related field with a minimum of 12 units of upper-division coursework in Asian Studies, Chinese Studies, or Japanese Studies, or their equivalent.
2. A minimum of 16 units or the equivalent (as determined by the graduate advisor) of an Asian language appropriate to the student’s proposed program. For the Option in Chinese Studies, a minimum of two years of college-level modern Chinese (Mandarin) or the equivalent is required.
3. A minimum GPA of 3.0 in the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) attempted and 3.0 in the major.
4. Three letters of recommendation from persons qualified to assess the applicant’s academic potential.
5. A Statement of Purpose of approximately 500 words describing the applicant’s preparation for the program, academic interests, and professional goals.
6. A writing sample of approximately 10 pages, double-spaced, that demonstrates the applicant’s abilities in writing and research.

Note: In light of the COVID-19 pandemic, the GRE requirement has been suspended for the M.A. in Asian Studies for the 2023-24 admissions cycle. We will NOT be accepting GRE scores.
Program name: Master of Arts in Asian Studies with option in Chinese Studies

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Arts in Asian Studies: Option in Teaching Chinese as a Foreign Language, applicants must meet the general university requirements for admission to graduate study as described in the CSULB Catalog. In addition, they must meet the following program requirements:

1. Submit a formal application for admission to the MAAS-TCFL program through Cal State Apply.
2. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a major in Chinese or equivalent. Applicants who do not have a bachelor’s degree in Chinese may be admitted conditionally, but they must complete all the prerequisites for the MAAS-TCFL program, to be determined by the TCFL advisor on a case-by-case basis.
3. A minimum GPA of 3.0 in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) of upper-division course work and a minimum of 3.0 GPA in the major. Applicants with a GPA between 2.7 and 2.99 may be admitted conditionally.
4. Proficiency in both Mandarin Chinese and English. Evidence of proficiency may include: native speaker status, transcripts that demonstrate the completion of a bachelor’s or a master’s degree from a college or university where the language of instruction is Chinese or English; or acceptable standardized test scores. For non-native English speakers: a minimum TOEFL score of 570 (PBT) or 88 (IBT); or a minimum IELTS score of 6.5. For non-native Chinese speakers: a minimum score of Advanced-Low on the ACTFL-OPIc for Mandarin Chinese. Students who do not meet this requirement may be admitted conditionally.
5. Submission of a satisfactory writing sample in English on any subject related to China (not to exceed five pages).
6. Submission of a Statement of Purpose.
7. Submission of three letters of recommendation.
8. Submission of transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
Program name: Master of Arts in Asian Studies - Teaching Chinese as a Foreign Language

Requirements: To be considered for admission to the M.A. program in Communication Studies, applicants must submit the following materials: An online application submitted through Cal State Apply. Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended. A statement of purpose (approximately 500-750 words) that addresses the applicant's reasons for pursuing graduate study, academic background and preparation for the M.A. program, and future career goals. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to the applicant's academic and/or professional potential. A scholarly writing sample of 10-20 pages that demonstrates the applicant's research and writing abilities. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0. Evidence of a baccalaureate degree in Communication Studies or a related field from an accredited institution. Applicants without a degree in Communication Studies may be required to complete up to 12 units of prerequisite coursework.
Program name: Master of Arts in Communication Studies

Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements of the university, specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are:

1. A bachelor’s degree with a major in economics from an accredited institution with a GPA of at least 3.0 in upper-division economics courses and 2.75 in all undergraduate courses.
2. Students with a bachelor’s degree in a field other than economics may be admitted to the program provided they have completed a set of prerequisite courses in economic theory and quantitative methods with a GPA of 3.0 or better and have an overall undergraduate GPA of 2.75 or better. The prerequisite courses are ECON 310, ECON 311, ECON 380, and one of the following: ECON 481, ECON 485, MATH 123.
3. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required for admission.
4. Three letters of recommendation.
5. A statement of purpose.
Program name: Master of Arts in Economics

Requirements:
An undergraduate degree with a major in English literature from an accredited institution. Applicants with majors in other fields may be considered for admission with the provision that they complete a prescribed series of undergraduate courses in English before beginning graduate coursework.
A grade point average of at least 3.25 in all undergraduate English courses and a grade point average of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units attempted.
You must submit the following materials via Cal State Apply by the deadline:
1. Statement of Purpose: Approximately 500 words, explaining your reasons for pursuing graduate study in English, your special interests in the field, and any aspects of your experience you consider relevant to your application. This statement is one of the most important parts of your application file; please be as specific as possible.
2. Writing Sample: An academic essay of 8-15 pages on a literary topic. We prefer that you submit a paper written for an upper-division undergraduate course; it may be revised.
3. Two Letters of Recommendation: Letters should be from former professors who know your work well. If you have been out of school for some time, you may substitute letters from employers or others who can speak to your academic potential. Letters are submitted online via Cal State Apply; you will be prompted to enter the names and email addresses of your recommenders.
4. Unofficial Transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
Program name: Master of Arts in English

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Science in Geographic Information Science (MSGISci) degree program, an applicant must satisfy the following minimum requirements:

1. A bachelor’s degree with a major in Geography or a related field from an accredited institution.
2. A minimum of 12 units of upper-division courses in Geography or a related field, with a GPA of at least 3.0 in those courses.
3. A minimum cumulative undergraduate GPA of 2.7.
4. GRE Exam scores are NOT required.

In addition to the online university application, applicants must also submit the following materials:

1. Statement of Purpose (500-1000 words) that describes how the applicant’s background and educational/professional goals would be served by pursuing the MSGISci degree.
2. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can evaluate the applicant’s academic and professional abilities and potential (submitted directly by the recommenders).
3. A professional resume or curriculum vitae (CV).
4. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
Program name: Master of Science in Geographic Information Science

Requirements: The Department of Geography requires prospective students to submit three letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with your academic background and potential for graduate study (at least two should be from faculty). You must also include a statement of purpose in your application. The GRE (Graduate Record Examinations) is not required for application to the M.A. in Geography program. International Students must have a TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) score of 550 or higher (paper-based), 213 or higher (computer-based), or 80 or higher (internet-based).
Program name: Master of Arts in Geography

Requirements:
In addition to the university application submitted online at Cal State Apply, all applicants must submit the following materials directly to the German Graduate Advisor, Department of RGRLL, California State University, Long Beach, 1250 Bellflower Blvd., Long Beach, CA 90840-2406:
1. Three letters of recommendation, preferably from former instructors who are able to comment on your academic qualifications for graduate work in German literature and/or linguistics. (Please ask your recommenders to send their letters directly to the German Graduate Advisor.)
2. A one-page statement of purpose, in English, outlining your reasons for pursuing graduate studies in German, your preparation for such study, your academic interests, and your professional goals.
3. A writing sample in German. This should be a paper that you have written for an upper-division course, preferably on a literary topic. It should be at least five pages in length.
4. A list of all upper-division German courses you have taken, the institution where you have taken them, and the grades you received.
5. A list of all German literary works you have read (in German).
6. A copy of your transcripts (unofficial is acceptable).
Program name: Master of Arts in German

Requirements: An applicant must have a bachelor’s degree with a major in history from an accredited institution, or a bachelor’s degree in another discipline with at least 24 units of upper-division history courses, or their equivalent, approved by the graduate advisor. A student must have a grade point average of at least 3.25 in all undergraduate work and 3.5 in all undergraduate history courses. Applicants who do not meet the grade point average requirements may be admitted on a case-by-case basis. Such students will be admitted as Conditionally Classified. All students must demonstrate a reading knowledge of at least one foreign language appropriate to their proposed field of study. Students will satisfy the requirement by passing a written examination administered by the appropriate language department. In addition to the university application and fee, applicants must submit the following materials directly to the History Department Graduate Advisor: 1. A writing sample (a paper of 10-25 pages in length, with footnotes and bibliography, from an upper-division history course). 2. A statement of purpose (1-2 pages in length) explaining the applicant’s reasons for pursuing graduate study in history, scholarly interests, and career goals. 3. Two letters of recommendation from faculty who can speak to the applicant’s academic potential. 4. Unofficial transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
Program name: Master of Arts in History

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the M.A. program in philosophy, an applicant must satisfy the general requirements for admission to graduate study at CSULB. For information regarding these requirements, see the CSULB Graduate Admissions webpage.

In addition, the following are required for admission to the Department of Philosophy:
1. A bachelor’s degree with a major in philosophy from a college or university accredited by a regional accrediting association. Applicants without a major in philosophy may be considered for admission, provided they have satisfactorily completed a substantial number of upper-division philosophy courses (typically, a minimum of 24 units), including at least one course in logic and at least one in the history of philosophy. At the discretion of the graduate advisor, a limited number of required courses may be taken after admission to the program.
2. A grade point average of at least 3.25 in all undergraduate philosophy courses, and a grade point average of at least 3.0 in all undergraduate work.
3. Two letters of recommendation from persons in a position to judge the applicant’s potential for success in a graduate philosophy program.
4. A sample of the applicant’s philosophical writing (approximately 10 pages in length).
5. A statement of purpose (approximately 500 words in length) describing the applicant’s philosophical interests and reasons for wanting to pursue the M.A. degree in philosophy at CSULB.
Program name: Master of Arts in Philosophy

Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the university, students seeking admission to the Master of Arts in Political Science must meet the following requirements:
1. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited university with a major in Political Science OR 20 upper-division units in Political Science with a grade of B or better and a bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in a related field.
2. An overall undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0. Students with an undergraduate GPA between 2.75 and 2.99 may be admitted if their GPA in the last 60 units is 3.0 or higher.
3. Three letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with the student’s academic work and potential. At least two letters should be from former professors.
4. A statement of purpose (approximately 500 words) that describes the applicant’s interest in political science, academic and career goals, and reasons for pursuing the M.A. in Political Science at CSULB.
5. A sample of written work (e.g., a term paper) that demonstrates the applicant’s research and analytical skills.
6. An interview with the Graduate Advisor (may be waived).
Program name: Master of Arts in Political Science

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the M.A. in Psychological Research program, applicants must:

1. Hold a baccalaureate degree with a major in Psychology from a regionally accredited institution, or have completed the undergraduate prerequisites for the M.S. program in Psychology at CSULB with a grade of “C” or better.
2. Have attained a grade-point average of at least 3.0 in all undergraduate psychology courses.
3. Have attained a grade-point average of at least 3.2 in the last 60 semester (or 90 quarter) units attempted.
4. Be approved by the department graduate admissions committee.

In addition to the university application, applicants must submit the following items: unofficial transcripts, a Statement of Purpose, three letters of recommendation, a current curriculum vitae (CV) or resume, a sample of your best scientific writing, and the MAPR Supplemental Application.
Program name: Master of Arts in Psychological Research

Requirements:
The MSIO program admits students for the fall semester only. To be considered for admission, applicants must:
1. Submit a university application via Cal State Apply.
2. Have a minimum of 24 units of psychology coursework, including a course in statistics and a course in research methods. All coursework must be completed with a grade of “C” or better. Students who do not have this coursework may complete it at a community college or another university.
3. Have a minimum GPA of 3.0 in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) of coursework and a minimum GPA of 3.0 in all psychology coursework.
4. Submit the following materials via Cal State Apply by the application deadline:
    *   Unofficial transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
    *   A resume that includes information about your academic, work, and volunteer experience. Please use the MSIO resume template.
    *   A Statement of Purpose describing your interest in I-O psychology, reasons for pursuing a master’s degree in I-O at CSULB, and career goals.
    *   Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to your academic and/or professional potential. It is strongly recommended that at least two letters be from university instructors.
Program name: Master of Science in Industrial/Organizational Psychology

Requirements:
Students seeking admission to the Master of Science degree program in Biology are required to submit an application to the university via Cal State Apply. In addition, prospective students must meet the following department-specific requirements for admission to the program:

1. Hold an acceptable baccalaureate degree in a biological science from an accredited institution, or have completed equivalent academic preparation as determined by the department graduate committee.
2. Have been in good academic standing at the last college or university attended.
3. Have a minimum cumulative undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
4. Submit three letters of recommendation from individuals who can comment on the applicant’s potential for success in a graduate program. At least two of these letters must be from faculty in a biological science.
5. Submit a statement of purpose that describes the applicant’s academic background, research interests and experience, and career goals.
6. Have made arrangements with a member of the faculty of the Department of Biological Sciences who has agreed to serve as the student’s thesis advisor.
Program name: Master of Science in Biology

Requirements:
Students must meet university admission requirements.

Students must also meet the departmental requirements below to be considered for admission to the M.S. degree program.

- General GRE scores are not required.
- A bachelor's degree in chemistry or biochemistry from an accredited institution. Students with a degree in a related field may be admitted conditionally and will be required to take any undergraduate chemistry courses that are deemed necessary by the graduate advisor.
- A grade-point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher in the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) of coursework.
- Three letters of recommendation from persons who can comment on the applicant's potential for success in a graduate program.
- A statement of purpose (500-1000 words) describing the applicant's research interests, professional goals, and reasons for pursuing the M.S. degree in chemistry at CSULB.
- A curriculum vitae (CV) or resume.
Program name: Master of Science in Chemistry

Requirements: Hold a baccalaureate degree with a major in geology, or a related field, from an accredited college or university. Have a grade-point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale for the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) of university/college coursework. Have taken the Graduate Record Examination (GRE); the General Test. Arrange to have three letters of recommendation from individuals who can evaluate the applicant’s potential for success in a graduate program sent to the graduate advisor. Submit a statement of purpose describing the applicant’s motivation and goals for pursuing an M.S. degree in geology. Submit a curriculum vitae or resume.
Program name: Master of Science in Geology

Requirements:
Admission will be granted to students who show aptitude for advanced training in mathematics. For admission to the Master of Science in Mathematics, students must satisfy the general requirements of the university. In addition, the student must have completed a bachelor's degree in mathematics or the equivalent of the following lower-and upper-division course work: MATH 122, 123, 224, 247, 323, 361A, 380, and 423 or their equivalents. In addition to the prerequisites for the MS in Mathematics, students wishing to enroll in the Option in Applied Mathematics must have completed MATH 364A or its equivalent.

To apply, follow the instructions at the graduate admissions website to apply to the university via Cal State Apply. The following documents must be uploaded into your Cal State Apply application:
1. Unofficial transcripts.
2. Statement of purpose: Describe your preparation for our MS program, your mathematical interests and goals, your specific option of interest, and why you are interested in our MS program in particular.
3. Three letters of recommendation. In Cal State Apply, you must provide the names and e-mail addresses of three recommenders. They will be invited to upload their letters of recommendation to the system. At least two of the three letters of recommendation must be from professors who can attest to your likely success in a graduate mathematics program.
Program name: Master of Science in Mathematics with option in Applied Math

Requirements: General admission requirements of the university (see the CSULB Catalog). A bachelor's degree in mathematics or a related field with a GPA of at least 3.0 in upper-division mathematics courses. Three letters of recommendation from college instructors who can attest to the applicant's potential for success in a graduate mathematics program. A statement of purpose of approximately 500 words, including a description of the applicant’s mathematical background, reasons for pursuing a master’s degree in mathematics, and professional goals. Teaching experience is desired but not required.
Program name: Master of Science in Mathematics for Educators

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Science degree program in Microbiology, a student must meet the following requirements:

1. An acceptable baccalaureate degree in Microbiology or in a closely related biological science from an accredited institution, or an equivalent degree determined by the University.
2. A grade-point average of at least 3.0 for the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) attempted. Students with a grade-point average of 2.7 to 2.99 may be admitted as conditionally classified if their application is otherwise strong.
3. At least one course in each of the following areas: general microbiology, microbial physiology or metabolism, and microbial genetics, each with a grade of “B” or better. Students lacking one or more of these courses may be admitted as conditionally classified and will be required to complete these courses with a grade of “B” or better before advancement to classified status.
4. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can evaluate the applicant’s potential for successful graduate study. At least two letters must be from the applicant’s former professors.
5. A written Statement of Purpose that describes the applicant’s motivation and goals for pursuing a graduate degree in microbiology, and how the MS degree in microbiology at CSULB will help the applicant achieve his/her goals.
6. A curriculum vitae (CV) or resume.
7. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is NOT required.
Program name: Master of Science in Microbiology

Requirements:
Students must meet the university graduate admission requirements. Students must also satisfy the following departmental requirements:
1. A bachelor’s degree in Physics or a related field (e.g., another physical science, engineering, or mathematics) from a regionally accredited institution, or the equivalent from a non-U.S. institution.
2. A grade point average of at least 2.7 (on a 4.0 scale) in the last 60 semester units (or 90 quarter units) attempted.
3. Satisfy the writing proficiency requirement through the GWAR Placement Examination or an approved course.
4. Submission of the scores for the Graduate Record Examinations (GRE) General Test is recommended, but not required.
Program name: Master of Science in Physics with option in Applied Physics

Requirements: An undergraduate degree in physics or a closely related field; Satisfactory grade point average in upper division physics and mathematics courses; Satisfactory score on the General Aptitude section of the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) (the Advanced Physics test is optional); Three letters of recommendation from persons in a position to judge the applicant's potential for graduate study in physics; A statement of purpose.
Program name: Master of Science in Physics with option in Computational Physics

Requirements: To enter one of the options in the Master of Science Degree in Science Education, a student must apply to the university. See Graduate Admissions for details. Admission Requirements: Current enrollment in a credential program or possession of a teaching credential (out-of-state or multiple subject credential is acceptable); A bachelor's degree with some science background; A grade point average (GPA) of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of upper division coursework or a 2.5 GPA and a high score on the Graduate Record Exam (GRE); Three letters of recommendation; and A written statement of purpose.
Program name: Master of Science in Science Education with option in Elementary & Middle School

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Science in Science Education program, applicants must have:

- An application for admission to the university.
- A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a major in a science or a closely related field.
- An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or better in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units.
- Competence in writing, demonstrated by an acceptable score on the GWAR Placement Exam (GPE) or a grade of “C” or better in a GWAR-certifying course. The GWAR is a university requirement and must be fulfilled before advancement to candidacy.
- Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can comment on the applicant’s potential for success.
- Submission of a statement of purpose.
- Resume with relevant experience.
Program name: Master of Science in Science Education with option in Informal Science Education

Requirements:

2. Have been in good standing at the last college attended.

Requirements: An applicant must have a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university. A minimum of 24 units of undergraduate or graduate coursework in a language other than English with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Passage of a language proficiency examination in a language other than English. Students for whom English is a second language must have a score of 550 or higher on the paper-based TOEFL test, 213 on the computer-based test, or 80 on the internet-based test (iBT). Hold or be eligible for a California teaching credential or have experience in a setting that serves school-age children. Complete the university application and the program application, including a statement of purpose, three letters of recommendation, and a writing sample.

Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements of the university, specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are:
1. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a major in mathematics or a related field (e.g., engineering, science); OR A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution AND a California Single Subject Credential in Mathematics; OR A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution AND completion of coursework that is equivalent to a minor in mathematics (a minimum of 22-24 semester units of mathematics coursework that includes one year of calculus and at least 9 units of upper division coursework approved by the advisor).
2. A minimum of 300 on the verbal and quantitative sections of the GRE General Test (the department may consider an applicant with a GRE score of 290-299 if other aspects of the applicant file are strong); OR An undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher.
3. A minimum GPA of 3.0 in all upper-division mathematics courses.
4. Each applicant file must contain three letters of recommendation and a statement of purpose. Letters should be from individuals who can comment on the applicant’s academic and/or professional abilities and potential for success in a graduate program. The statement of purpose should describe the applicant’s background, interests, and goals for pursuing the M.A. degree in Education with an option in Mathematics Education.

Requirements: Admission Requirements for the M.S. in Counseling, Option in School Counseling: 1. Completion of university and departmental application forms with all required documents including two sets of official transcripts from every college or university attended, a personal statement and three letters of recommendation. 2. A minimum grade point average of 2.85 for the last 60 semester units attempted. 5. Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can attest to the applicant’s academic and personal qualifications for a career in counseling. Evidence of personal qualifications, experience, and temperament necessary for a career in school counseling. 8. The School Counseling faculty strongly recommend applicants complete the CBEST or meet the BSR by the application deadline. The minimum prerequisite coursework required for admission into the program are: Introduction to Psychology or a similar course; Introduction to Statistics or a similar course; Human/Child Development or a similar course.

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the M.S. program in Aerospace Engineering, a student must:
1. Have an undergraduate degree in aerospace or mechanical engineering with a GPA of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units.
Students with undergraduate degrees in other fields of engineering, mathematics, or physics may be admitted to the program on a conditional basis (classified with deficiencies). These students are required to take a number of undergraduate courses to make up for any deficiency in their background. The deficiency courses do not carry credit toward the M.S. degree.
2. Students with a GPA between 2.5 and 3.0 may be admitted if they have a GRE General test score with a minimum of 150 in the quantitative section, 143 in the verbal section, and a 3.0 in the analytical writing section.
3. Students whose native language is not English are required to take the TOEFL test and have a minimum score of 213 (computer-based) or 80 (internet-based) or IELTS (6.0). This requirement is waived for students who have a degree from a U.S. university.
4. Three letters of recommendation are required for all applicants.
Program name: Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering

Requirements: In addition to University requirements for admission to graduate study, applicants for the Master of Science in Civil Engineering must have: A bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or a closely related branch of engineering from an ABET-accredited university with a GPA of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) attempted. If the bachelor's degree is not in Civil Engineering, the applicant must complete a program of prerequisite courses, determined on a case-by-case basis, with a GPA of 3.0 or better. Applicants with a bachelor's degree in a field other than engineering may be considered for admission and must complete a program of prerequisite courses. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required. A complete application requires official transcripts, three letters of recommendation, and a Statement of Purpose.
Program name: Master of Science in Civil Engineering with option in Construction Management

Requirements:
An undergraduate degree in Civil Engineering or its equivalent.

Admission will be granted to students who meet the university’s general admission requirements and who are judged by the Civil Engineering Graduate Committee to be prepared for graduate-level work in Civil Engineering.

Students having undergraduate degrees in engineering fields other than civil engineering or in related disciplines (e.g., mathematics, physics, or geology) may be admitted to Conditionally Classified status. Such students will be required to complete a program of preparatory coursework, to be determined by the Civil Engineering Graduate Advisor in consultation with the student. All preparatory courses must be passed with a grade of “C” or better. These courses will not count towards the M.S. degree. After completing the preparatory coursework, the student will be reclassified as a Classified Graduate Student.

All applicants must have a minimum GPA of 2.7 in the last 60 semester units (90 quarter units) attempted and be in good standing at the last college attended. Applicants who do not meet these requirements may be admitted to Conditionally Classified status following a special review by the Civil Engineering Graduate Committee.

All applicants who have earned their undergraduate degree outside of the U.S. are required to take the Graduate Record Examination (GRE). The minimum acceptable scores are: Verbal 143, Quantitative 151, and Analytical Writing 3.5. Students who do not meet these requirements may be admitted to Conditionally Classified status following a special review by the Civil Engineering Graduate Committee. The GRE requirement is waived for applicants who have earned their undergraduate degree from an ABET-accredited Civil Engineering Program in the U.S.
Program name: Master of Science in Civil Engineering with option in Environmental/Water Resources

Requirements:
Application to the School of Art is a two-part process. You must complete both steps to be considered for admission.
Step 1: Complete the university application on Cal State Apply.
Step 2: Complete the School of Art MFA Program Application on Slideroom which includes: Statement of Purpose (500-1000 words), Letters of Recommendation (3) submitted through Slideroom by the recommenders, Transcripts (unofficial), Portfolio of 20 images of your strongest, most recent work that demonstrates your readiness for graduate study in art, and an Image list (including title, medium, date, and dimensions for each piece).

Prerequisites:
Hold a baccalaureate degree in Art from an accredited institution, or a baccalaureate degree with a minimum of 24 upper-division units in Art, equivalent to the CSULB BFA degree in Studio Art.
Submit a portfolio of artwork that demonstrates a potential for success in the program.
Have a minimum of 2.75 GPA in the last 60 units of undergraduate coursework and a 3.0 GPA in all upper-division Art courses.
Program name: Master of Fine Arts in International Studio Arts

Requirements: Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 grade-point average in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of undergraduate coursework and a Bachelor’s degree with a major in dance from an accredited institution (a Bachelor’s degree with a minor in dance and substantial professional experience is also acceptable). In addition to the university application, a Department Application must be submitted which includes: a 500-word Statement of Purpose, a formal research paper of 8 to 12 pages, a current resume or curriculum vitae, three letters of recommendation, and a video audition.

Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Master of Music degree program, the applicant must:
1. Hold a baccalaureate degree in music from an accredited institution, or the equivalent, with a GPA of 3.0 or better in upper-division music courses.
2. Demonstrate the potential for success in the chosen field in an audition and/or interview, and by the submission of all required application materials.
3. Students whose undergraduate preparation is deemed insufficient may be required to take remedial courses that will not be counted toward the master’s degree.

For the Instrumental/Choral Conducting option, the following must be uploaded to the Music Graduate Application Portal:
1. Current résumé or curriculum vitae, including a comprehensive list of repertoire studied and performed.
2. Statement of Purpose (approximately 500 words), addressing your purpose in pursuing graduate study in music, career goals, and why you believe the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music is a good place for you to study.
3. Three current letters of recommendation from persons qualified to evaluate your potential for graduate study in music.
4. A scholarly paper, preferably on a topic in music, that demonstrates the applicant’s ability to write cogently about music and to conduct research. The paper should be a minimum of five pages, double-spaced.
5. A pre-screening video of approximately 15-20 minutes of the applicant conducting both rehearsal and performance is required.
Program name: Master of Music with option in Instrumental/Choral Conducting

Requirements: In addition to the general requirements of the university, prospective Master of Music students must satisfy the following requirements for admission to the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music. An applicant must: 1. Hold a baccalaureate degree with a major in music from an accredited institution or the equivalent. 2. Have a GPA of 3.0 or higher in all undergraduate upper-division coursework in music. 3. Complete the university application via Cal State Apply. 4. Complete the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music Supplemental Application which includes a prescreening audition, a curriculum vitae/résumé, a statement of purpose (250-500 words), a repertoire list, three letters of recommendation, and unofficial transcripts. 5. Perform a successful audition for the appropriate faculty in the declared area of specialization. 6. Demonstrate proficiency in music theory, aural skills, and music history, as determined by the Graduate Placement Examination administered by the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music.
Program name: Master of Music with option in Opera

Requirements: In addition to the general requirements of the university, specific information for application to the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music is available at the BCCM Graduate Studies website. A bachelor’s degree with a major in music (or its equivalent) from an accredited institution is required. Two letters of recommendation from persons qualified to judge the academic and musical potential of the applicant are also required. Applicants will be required to audition and take the graduate placement examinations given by the Conservatory in music theory and music history. Students who do not pass the graduate placement examinations will be required to complete specific review courses with a grade of “B” or better prior to enrolling in graduate-level courses in music theory and music history. The minimum GPA required for admission is 3.0 in the last 60 semester units of undergraduate work and 3.0 in upper division major courses.
Program name: Master of Music with option in Jazz Studies

Requirements:
Prospective students in music education apply for admission to the Master of Arts degree program for the fall semester only. The application requires two parts:
1. Apply to the university via Cal State Apply between October 1 and January 15.
2. A supplemental application to the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music via GetAcceptd is also required by January 15.

To be considered for admission to the Master of Arts in Music, applicants must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. An undergraduate degree in music or its equivalent with a GPA of 3.0 or higher in all upper-division music courses.
2. Submission of all required application materials as stipulated by the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music.
3. Successful completion of the Bob Cole Conservatory of Music Graduate Placement Examinations in Music History and Music Theory.
4. Successful completion of the appropriate entrance audition, interview, or submission of portfolio.
Program name: Master of Arts in Music Education

Requirements: In addition to the general requirements of the university, specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are: an undergraduate degree in music or its equivalent, with a GPA of 3.0 or better in all upper-division music courses, and successful completion of the appropriate entrance examinations as determined by the faculty in the student’s area of specialization. For the Musicology (MA) option, applicants must submit the following via the Music GETAcceptd portal: A Statement of Purpose (500-600 words) describing your academic and research interests and your professional goals; A substantive example of your scholarly writing on a musical topic (e.g., a term paper from an upper-division music history course); Three current letters of recommendation from persons in a position to speak of your musical and academic abilities; A résumé or curriculum vitae that lists your educational background, professional experience, and scholarly/creative accomplishments; Unofficial transcripts from all previous colleges. A brief on-campus or virtual interview with the Musicology faculty will be scheduled after a preliminary review of your application materials.
Program name: Master of Arts in Musicology

Requirements: In order to apply for the MFA Acting Program at CSULB, prospective students must complete both the University application through Cal State Apply, and a departmental audition. To complete your application file, the following supplemental materials must be uploaded through Cal State Apply by the application deadline: A current résumé listing theatrical experience, Three letters of recommendation from individuals who can speak to your qualifications, A Statement of Purpose of no more than three pages, double-spaced, A headshot, Unofficial transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. Admission to the MFA Acting Program is by audition only.
Program name: Master of Fine Arts in Theatre Arts with option in Acting

Requirements: A current resume; A statement of purpose, 300-500 words, articulating your reasons for pursuing this degree; Two letters of recommendation from individuals able to comment on your academic and/or professional background; A written analytical essay, 1000-2000 words, that is a critical review of a theatrical performance you have recently seen or an essay that details your approach to producing one of the plays from this list: Fences, In The Heights, Next to Normal, Water by the Spoonful, or Sweat. The GRE will be waived for Fall 2024 graduate applicants.
Program name: Master of Fine Arts in Theatre Arts with option in Theatre Management (MFA/MBA)

Requirements: Applicants must possess a bachelor’s degree with a major in Japanese, or its equivalent, from an accredited college or university, with a grade point average of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester (or 90 quarter) units attempted, and at least 3.0 in the major. Proficiency in Japanese equivalent to having completed all the requirements for the BA in Japanese at CSULB is also required. In addition to the university application, applicants must submit the following departmental application materials directly to the Asian and Asian American Studies Department (AAAS) Graduate Advisor: a Statement of Purpose (1-2 pages), a Writing Sample (10-15 pages in Japanese or English), three Letters of Recommendation, and an unofficial copy of transcripts.
Program name: Master of Arts in Japanese Language & Pedagogy

Requirements: To be admitted in classified status, an applicant must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution with a major in business administration, computer science, or information systems; a minimum GPA of 3.0 in the last 60 semester units; and a GMAT score of 500 or higher (or a comparable GRE score). The GMAT/GRE requirement is waived for applicants with a GPA of 3.0 or better from a business program accredited by AACSB or from a domestic U.S. university. The waiver also applies to those with a degree in computer science or computer engineering from an ABET-accredited program, or those with 3+ years of professional full-time IT work experience in the U.S. Required documents to upload to the Cal State Apply application include unofficial transcripts, a Statement of Purpose, a resume, and a GMAT or GRE test score (if applicable).

Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must meet the following requirements: a bachelor's degree from a regionally-accredited university, a minimum GPA of 2.5 (cumulative or in the last 60 semester units), and submission of a Cal State Apply application with official transcripts from all colleges/universities attended. The following documents are required to be uploaded to the application: a current résumé, a statement of purpose, a video statement of purpose, and two letters of recommendation.
Program name: Master of Business Administration (MBA)

Requirements:
All applicants must complete the Cal State Apply online application and pay the non-refundable $70 application fee. The following materials are required to be submitted with the application:
- Current Resume (two page maximum)
- Statement of Purpose
- Video Statement of Purpose
- Two Letters of Recommendation: Applicants should provide contact information for their recommenders in Cal State Apply. The recommenders will then be sent a link to a standard recommendation form.
- Official Transcripts: One official transcript from each college or university attended is required.
- GMAT/GRE: The GMAT/GRE is currently waived for all MBA Programs for the Spring 2024 and Fall 2024 terms.
- International Applicants: International Applicants are required to take the TOEFL or IELTS exam unless they have a bachelor’s degree from a U.S. institution.
Program name: Master of Business Administration (MBA) Accelerated

Requirements: Specific requirements for admission to classified graduate status are: a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution, or an equivalent degree from a non-U.S. institution; being in good academic standing at the last college or university attended; and a grade point average (GPA) of at least 2.75 on a 4.0 scale. A minimum of two years of full-time, professional work experience after completion of a bachelor's degree is preferred. Required application materials to be submitted include a completed Cal State Apply Application, a current résumé, a statement of purpose, a video statement of purpose, and official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
Program name: Master of Business Administration (MBA) Evening

Requirements: A bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited university. GPA of at least 2.5 in the last 60 semester (90 quarter) units of coursework. At least two years of full-time, professional work experience. The Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) or Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is required. An approved GMAT/GRE waiver is available for highly qualified applicants. International applicants must submit a TOEFL score of at least 80 (iBT).
Program name: Master of Business Administration (MBA) Online

Requirements:
A master's degree from a regionally accredited institution.
A cumulative grade point average of at least 3.0 in all upper-division and graduate coursework.
A current resume or curriculum vitae that documents a minimum of three years of professional experience in an educational setting, including leadership responsibilities.

A sample of academic writing that demonstrates analytical and writing skills.
